description: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde announced that the government is advancing payments for the Ladki Bahin Yojana beneficiaries for October and November due to the upcoming assembly election code of conduct. This preemptive measure ensures women continue to receive their Rs 1500 monthly aid without disruption.

title: FIR lodged against Saurabh Bharadwaj, 3 AAP MLAs for ruckus over bus marshal issue
description: Delhi Police filed a case against AAP minister Saurabh Bharadwaj and three MLAs for the disturbance at the Secretariat over bus marshal reinstatement. The MLAs are charged with criminal intimidation and wrongful restraint. AAP and BJP MLAs clashed, accusing each other of misconduct regarding the reinstatement issue.

title: Farooq Abdullah invites PDP to support NC-Congress alliance; 'We need to keep J&K integrated...'
Caste Census Survey: Siddaramaiah faces pressure from within Congress to place it before Cabinet
description: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah is planning to present the caste census report to the Cabinet amid pressure from OBs, SC/ST leaders and prominent Congress figures. The report is facing opposition from Lingayats and Vokkaligas, raising concerns about its implementation despite strong advocacy from senior Congress members.

title: Will campaign for BJP if BJP-ruled states get free electricity before Delhi polls: Kejriwal
description: Arvind Kejriwal challenges PM Modi to offer free electricity in BJP-ruled states before Delhi elections, promising to support BJP if implemented. He criticizes BJP's governance in Haryana and Jammu and Kashmir, and warns that BJP's return to power might end essential public services in Delhi.

title: Ex-Jharkhand CM Champai Soren hospitalised
description: Former Jharkhand Chief Minister Champai Soren was admitted to Tata Main Hospital in Jamshedpur due to blood sugar complications. He felt dizzy after his blood sugar levels dropped. His condition is stable and improving. Soren recently joined the BJP after leaving the JMM and briefly held the chief minister position earlier this year before stepping down.

title: Bypolls on 10 assembly seats INDIA bloc's first major test in UP since LS gains
description: The upcoming bypolls on 10 assembly seats in Uttar Pradesh will test the unity of the INDIA bloc, specifically between Samajwadi Party and Congress, as they haven't finalized a seat-sharing agreement. Congress demands five seats, and both parties aim to prevent BJP's success.

title: Left MLA Jaleel links gold smuggling through Karipur airport to Muslim community, sparks row
description: K T Jaleel, a Left MLA, caused controversy by stating that most gold smugglers through Malappuram airport are Muslims. He urged community leaders to address this issue. IUML and MLA P V Anvar criticized him, calling the statement derogatory. This controversy arose amid debates over Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan's alleged comments on Malappuram.

title: Will campaign for BJP if PM Modi provides free electricity in NDA-ruled states before assembly polls: Arvind Kejriwal
description: Arvind Kejriwal challenges PM Modi to offer free electricity in BJP-ruled states ahead of Delhi elections, vowing to support BJP if the demand is met. He criticizes BJP's 'double engine' governments for alleged corruption and anti-poor measures, predicting their fall in Haryana and Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Priyanka Gandhi slams govt over IMPCL 'privatisation' bid
description: Priyanka Gandhi criticised the Modi government for planning to privatise Indian Medicines Pharmaceutical Corporation Limited, suggesting the motive is to benefit select friends. She highlighted that the profitable company supports local farmers and workers, challenging the government's purported support for Ayurveda and AYUSH.

title: BJP stoking communal tensions in Goa, its attempts will not go unchallenged: Rahul Gandhi
description: Rahul Gandhi accuses BJP of inciting communal tensions in Goa, undermining its natural and social harmony by exploiting ecologically sensitive areas. He asserts that the people of Goa and India are united against the BJP's divisive strategies and illegal actions.

title: 'Exit Poll Ki Pol Pahle Bhi Khul Chuki Hai…', BJP’s Anil Vij denies exit polls of Haryana Elections
Punjab: Local AAP leader shot at; Akali leader blamed
description: In Fazilka, a local Aam Aadmi Party leader, Mandeep Singh Brar, was shot during an altercation with Akali workers. He sustained a chest injury and is in stable condition. AAP MLA Jagdeep Kamboj accused Shiromani Akali Dal leader Vardev Singh Noni Mann of the shooting. Police promise strict action. Panchayat elections are on October 15.

title: Congress' Jairam Ramesh highlights 'three dark clouds' threatening Indian economy's growth
description: Jairam Ramesh criticizes PM Narendra Modi's government by highlighting three critical economic issues: inconsistent private-sector investment, stagnation in manufacturing, and declining real wages and productivity. He argues these factors threaten India's economic growth and investor confidence, exacerbated by recent government policies.

title: Hindu society must unite for its security: Mohan Bhagwat
description: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat declared India a Hindu nation and emphasized the importance of Hindu unity by removing linguistic, caste, and regional differences. He urged RSS volunteers to foster social harmony and civic consciousness. The event in Rajasthan was attended by 3,827 volunteers and several senior RSS functionaries.

title: Is India's economy on the brink? Congress slams Modi's economic claims as 'bombastic'
description: Congress claims the Indian economy faces major challenges. It points to low private sector investment, stagnating manufacturing, and a decline in real wages and productivity. High tariffs and Chinese imports hurt manufacturing. Low wages and productivity hit consumer demand, affecting investment. These could harm long-term economic growth if unaddressed.

title: Siddaramaiah fumes at opposition for targeting his wife in MUDA case
description: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah criticizes BJP and JD(S) for bringing his wife into the MUDA case. He believes the opposition is targeting him because of his background. Siddaramaiah states his government's schemes empower minorities and backward communities, which frustrates the opposition. He denies any wrongdoing and attributes opposition attacks to political motives.

title: What Jammu and Kashmir Election results could mean for Modi, Rahul, Abdullahs and Muftis
description: The exit polls for Jammu and Kashmir predict a lead for the NC-Congress combine, with the PDP potentially playing a crucial role in government formation. The results will significantly impact key figures like PM Modi, Rahul Gandhi, Omar Abdullah, and Iltija Mufti.

title: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar indicates ties with BJP stronger now
description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar highlighted the growing strength of the JD(U)-BJP alliance during a JD(U) state executive meeting, while urging for special status or assistance for Bihar. With the state budget now at Rs 3 lakh crore, Kumar praised PM Modi and Home Minister Shah for their support. The party aims to secure 225 out of 243 seats in the 2025 assembly elections.

title: Haryana Exit Poll Results 2024: Congress set for strong comeback, BJP to fall short of majority, pollsters predict
World Bank considering 27 of 30 suggestions on MDBs by G20 Independent Expert Group: FM Nirmala Sitharaman
description: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman expressed appreciation for the World Bank as it is considering 27 out of 30 G20 recommendations to strengthen multilateral development banks. These recommendations aim to fight extreme poverty, promote shared prosperity, and support global public goods. The discussion took place with Nick Stern during the G20 India Presidency meeting.

title: Jammu and Kashmir parties welcome EAM S Jaishankar's SCO visit to Pakistan
description: Former Jammu Kashmir chief minister Farooq Abdullah expressed hope that India's External Affairs Minister S. Jaishankar's upcoming visit to Pakistan for the SCO meeting will foster better relations between the two countries. He emphasized the importance of dialogue over war, and desired that both nations work together to address economic issues and strengthen ties.

title: Poorer nation suits Congress: PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi encouraged voters in Washim and Thane to prevent the Congress from coming to power. He accused the Congress of wanting to keep the country weak and poor and blamed them for promoting societal division. Modi emphasised that Congress and its allies impede development and should be kept out of power.

title: J&K Exit Poll Result 2024: NC-Congress combine has edge but BJP snapping at heels
Simultaneous polls not against Constitution, federalism: Ram Nath Kovind
description: Former president Ram Nath Kovind, who led the panel on 'one nation, one election,' stated the concept is constitutional. An implementation committee will review necessary amendments. He noted frequent elections disrupt development and trigger unaccounted money use. The Union Cabinet recently approved the proposal, and the high-level committee recommended synchronised national, state, and local elections.

title: Brand Rahul gaining steam, Congress comeback in Haryana: 5 key takeaways from exit poll results
description: Exit polls ahead of Haryana and Jammu & Kashmir assembly elections show Congress and its alliance with NC performing well, suggesting a decline in Modi's popularity and a rise in Rahul Gandhi's appeal. Polls predict Congress's strong comeback in Haryana and a mixed performance in Jammu & Kashmir.

title: Bus marshals' hiring: AAP minister lays at BJP MLA's feet to seek LG's nod; CM Atishi submits cabinet note
description: Delhi's Chief Minister Atishi, with BJP MLAs, met Lt Governor VK Saxena to reinstate bus marshals. AAP leaders accused the BJP of betrayal as they claimed the BJP did not push for the approval of the cabinet note by the LG. AAP leaders held a protest and were later detained by the police outside the LG's house.

title: Haryana and J&K Exit Polls: How exit polls are conducted?
description: Exit poll results for Haryana and Jammu and Kashmir assembly elections have been released today. They offer an indication of voter preferences. Official election results are expected on October 8. Exit polls capture voter sentiment post-voting and provide insights into election outcomes. They are regulated by the Election Commission of India.

title: Exit Polls vs Actual Results: Seven times when they were totally off the mark
description: Exit Poll Result 2024: Exit polls have often been inaccurate in predicting election outcomes in India. Notable instances include the 2024 Lok Sabha, 2023 Chhattisgarh, 2017 Uttar Pradesh, 2015 Bihar, and 2015 Delhi elections. Despite exit poll predictions, actual results have frequently deviated significantly, demonstrating the uncertainty of such forecasts.

title: Hope it will be start of better relationship between India, Pakistan: Farooq Abdullah on Jaishankar visit
description: National Conference president Farooq Abdullah hopes that External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar's upcoming visit to Islamabad for the SCO meeting will initiate better relations between India and Pakistan, enabling discussions on economic and bilateral issues, despite longstanding tensions.

title: Aim for 220 plus tally for NDA in assembly polls: Nitish tells JD(U)
description: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar urges JD(U) to target over 200 seats for NDA in upcoming 2025 state polls. At JD(U) state executive meeting, he highlights NDA's past success and recent Lok Sabha performance, while expressing gratitude for BJP leaders' support. Relief efforts for flood-hit regions lauded.

title: AIMIM asks Hyderabad police to slap case against Yati Narsinghanand
description: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi seeks Hyderabad police to file a criminal case against Uttar Pradesh Hindutva leader Yati Narsinghanand for allegedly making derogatory remarks against Prophet Muhammed. Owaisi argues that Narsinghanand violated his bail terms, thus demanding his bail cancellation and immediate arrest.

title: Won't resign on opposition's false accusation, says Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
description: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah rebuffs resignation demands amid allegations in MUDA site allotment case. He vows to clarify to the public, while opposition pressures him following a special court order for Lokayukta investigation. Siddaramaiah's wife relinquishes ownership of the concerned plots.

title: Congress targets PM Modi ahead of Maharashtra visit, questions BJP's stand on caste census
description: Ahead of PM Modi's Thane visit, Congress questions BJP's stance on caste census and reservation cap, criticizes Mahayuti's election delays as undemocratic, and challenges BJP's efforts on farmer suicides and educational reservations, calling for answers on urgent social issues.

title: Congress being run by gang of urban Naxals, says PM Modi
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi accused Congress of being influenced by urban Naxals and urged unity to counter their divisive agenda. He criticized Congress for aligning with harmful elements and alleged its involvement in drug-related scandals. Modi also condemned Congress for its discriminatory attitude towards marginalized communities.

title: Removing 50% cap on quota necessary to protect Constitution, says Rahul Gandhi
description: Rahul Gandhi emphasised the need to remove the 50% cap on reservation to protect the Constitution. He assured that the Congress and INDIA bloc will pass laws to remove this limit. Gandhi also promised the passage of a law on caste census in both Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha, stating no power could stop it.

title: Haryana Elections 2024: 'Never implemented…,' ML Khattar attacks Rahul Gandhi on OPS
PAC head Venugopal working to defame govt: Nishikant Dubey to LS Speaker
description: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey has accused Congress member and PAC chairman K C Venugopal of raising false issues to tarnish the central government and disrupt India's economy. Venugopal is alleged to be misusing his position, targeting SEBI's chairperson based on unverified claims by Hindenburg Research. This situation hints at potential tensions in upcoming committee meetings.

title: 'Ideology not right': Rahul Gandhi slams BJP over Shivaji's statue collapse in Maharashtra
Media must take stand on anti-national narratives: Vice Prez Jagdeep Dhankhar
description: Vice President Jagdeep Dhankhar urges the media to combat anti-national narratives and misinformation. He highlights the need for media to act impartially, emphasizing the importance of editorial space for critical viewpoints and the use of technology to counter fake narratives.

title: No action against media house which interviewed CM as it apologised: LDF
description: The ruling LDF in Kerala stated there is no need for legal action against a media house for allegedly misquoting CM Pinarayi Vijayan because the media house has apologised. The Congress-led opposition demanded action, but the LDF believes respectful criticism suffices. The controversy involved allegations of PR agency use for arranging CM interviews.

title: What has India gained? What has Pakistan lost?: Kapil Sibal asks as Jaishankar gears up to travel to Pakistan for SCO Summit
description: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will lead the Indian delegation to Pakistan for the SCO Summit 2024. This will be the first visit by an Indian minister to Pakistan in nine years. Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal questioned the benefits and losses of this visit. The meeting is scheduled for October 15-16 in Islamabad.

title: Pune court summons Rahul Gandhi on Oct 23 in Savarkar defamation case
description: A special court in Pune has issued a summons to Rahul Gandhi in a criminal defamation case. The case is filed by the grandnephew of Vinayak Damodar Savarkar. The summons is related to remarks Gandhi allegedly made against the Hindutva ideologue. Rahul Gandhi is required to appear before the court on October 23.

title: NCP (Ajit Pawar faction) leader Sachin Kurmi killed by unidentified persons in Mumbai's Byculla
description: NCP leader Sachin Kurmi was murdered with a sharp-edged weapon in Byculla, Mumbai. The incident occurred at midnight, and he was declared dead at JJ Hospital. Police are investigating the attack involving 2 to 3 unidentified assailants. Further details are awaited.

title: From Olympic medalist Manu Bhaker to CM Saini, Haryana casts vote for 90 Assembly seats
Polling begins for 90 Assembly seats in Haryana
description: Polling for all 90 Assembly seats in Haryana began on Saturday under tight security. Over two crore voters are eligible to decide the fate of Chief Minister Nayab Singh Saini and other key candidates. The ruling BJP aims for a hat-trick while counting of votes will take place on October 8.

title: JMM's Kalpana Soren leads INDIA Bloc's women campaign in J'khand
description: Kalpana Soren, wife of Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren, emerges as a key campaigner for the JMM-Congress alliance, focusing on galvanizing women voters through the 'Maiya Samman Yatra'. Joined by state ministers Bebi Devi and Dipika Pandey Singh, they have conducted over 50 outreach events in Palamu and Kolhan divisions.

title: Trump’s Speeches, Increasingly Angry and Rambling, Reignite the Question of Age
description: With the passage of time, the 78-year-old former president’s speeches have grown darker, harsher, longer, angrier, less focused, more profane and increasingly fixated on the past, according to a review of his public appearances over the years.

title: Like Trump, Vance Wavers on What to Do With Obamacare
description: JD Vance seemed to back away from a proposal to separate healthy and sick people in insurance markets, which could cause major disruption for people with pre-existing conditions.

title: It All Seemed So Conventional. And Then Came Jan. 6.
description: JD Vance may well be thinking about 2028 and beyond. He will need a lot more than a fairly mild 90-minute debate to fully soften his image.

title: In Final Stretch, Biden Faces Some of the Biggest Crises of His Presidency
description: Even as President Biden recedes from view, some of the most consequential days of his term may be ahead of him.

title: Harris Will Appear in a Whirlwind of Interviews, Most of Them Friendly
description: After mostly avoiding interviews as her campaign began, the vice president will hold several this week, including with Howard Stern, Stephen Colbert and the hosts of “The View.”

title: Melinda French Gates’s New Life: Abortion Politics and Kamala Harris
description: After her divorce from Bill Gates, Ms. French Gates came into her own billions of dollars, with which she could do whatever she chose. She used to insist on appearing nonpartisan, but no more.

title: Trump’s Return to Scene of Attack Was a Do-Over in More Ways Than One
description: The former president returned to the stage where a gunman tried to kill him in July and tried to recapture some of the momentum he had before President Biden dropped out.

title: Elon Musk Leaps to Trump’s Side in Rally Appearance
description: Mr. Musk, the world’s richest man and the leader of Tesla and X,  delivered a dark warning during an animated appearance at former President Donald J. Trump’s rally.

title: Kamala Harris Meets With Arab and Muslim Leaders in Michigan
description: The meeting, which took place backstage, came as Vice President Kamala Harris’s campaign ramped up efforts to appeal directly to Arab and Muslim voters in the final weeks before the election.

title: Kamala Harris Visits North Carolina to Check on Hurricane Response
description: The vice president visited Charlotte, N.C., for an update on relief efforts after Hurricane Helene ravaged wide swaths of the Southeast.

title: Widow of Man Killed in July Attack on Trump Returns for Rally
description: Helen Comperatore, whose husband, Corey Comperatore, was killed when a gunman tried to assassinate former President Donald J. Trump, returned to honor her husband’s memory.

title: Security Is Tighter for Trump Rally at Site of July Assassination Attempt
description: The Secret Service has deployed large forces to protect former President Donald J. Trump as he prepares to hold a rally in Butler, Pa., where a gunman attacked him in July.

title: Hurricane Helene Ravaged North Carolina’s Roads, With No Timeline for Repairs
description: Repairing the roads in the region near the North Carolina-Tennessee border could take months. Some residents worry about the impact on the local economy.

title: 30 Days Out, the Harris and Trump Campaigns Brace for ‘Trench Warfare’
description: With tight contests in all seven battleground states, the candidates are pressing for a few thousand votes that could sway the outcome of the entire election.

title: Supporters Who Watched as Trump Was Shot Prepare to Welcome Him Back
description: Donald J. Trump is returning to Butler, Pa., to hold another rally at the site where he was nearly assassinated in July in an attack that killed a man and wounded two others.

title: Campaigning for Harris, Women Share Their Abortion Stories With Neighbors
description: The Harris campaign is trying to transform women in battleground states into an organizing force who can drive their friends and family to the polls.

title: As Lawmaker Claims Trump’s Shooting Was Inside Job, G.O.P. Indulges Him
description: Representative Eli Crane, a first-term Arizona Republican, has emerged as the chief right-wing voice pushing conspiracy theories about the Trump assassination attempts.

title: Campus Protest Investigations Hang Over Schools as New Academic Year Begins
description: Dozens of discrimination complaints brought by conservative and pro-Jewish groups after the Oct. 7 attacks last year have spawned lengthy federal inquiries that some worry could chill free speech on campus.

title: Behind Trump’s Views on Ukraine: Putin’s Gambit and a Political Grudge
description: The roots of Donald Trump’s animus toward Ukraine — an issue with profound consequences should he be elected again — can be found in a yearlong series of events spanning 2016 and 2017.

title: Biden Urges Congress to Replenish Disaster Relief Funds Quickly
description: The president said a Small Business Administration program needed to help business owners recover from Hurricane Helene was set to run out of money in weeks, before Congress reconvenes.

title: 5 Takeaways From Melania Trump’s Book: Abortion Rights, 2020 Election and More
description: Shining a little more light on her mysterious life, her memoir details her support for abortion rights, her doubts about the 2020 election and her explanation for that “I really don’t care” jacket.

title: In North Carolina Town Hall, Trump Makes a Series of Promises to Appeal to Veterans
description: Donald J. Trump answered preselected questions from a pro-military crowd who echoed his false claims and approved of his vow to conduct massive deportations of undocumented immigrants.

title: Elon Musk joins Trump at U.S. election rally, declares ‘I am dark MAGA’
description: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk cast the upcoming presidential election in dire terms during an appearance with Donald Trump.

title: MPs to speak at Ottawa march marking one year since Oct. 7 Hamas-Israel conflict
description: A Liberal MP and a Conservative MP will be part of a team delivering speeches at an event in Ottawa commemorating the one year anniversary of the attacks on Oct. 7.

title: Canada has quietly raised foreign interference with China 48 times in two years
description: Statistics released by the foreign interference commission Friday suggest active discussions between Canadian diplomats and China on influence, surveillance.

title: Iran’s supreme leader hails missile attack on Israel as ‘shining’ job
description: Iran’s supreme leader on Friday praised the country’s recent missile strike on Israel and said it was ready to do it again if necessary, state TV reported.

title: Canada to back funding for African countries, scientific research at Francophonie
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau is set to take part in an armchair discussion on artificial intelligence in France on Friday as the Francophonie summit kicks off.

title: House of Commons grinds to halt over allegations of Liberal ‘corruption’
description: Conservative House leader Andrew Scheer said the governing Liberals would rather see the House bogged down in debate than produce documents related to misspent government dollars.

title: RCMP nixed probe into suspected PRC-linked money laundering network
description: Shutting down the alleged money laundering network would have 'no significant impact' on the larger problem, the national police force decided.

title: Supreme Court to hear Quebec’s challenge to daycare access for asylum seekers
description: The Supreme Court of Canada says it will hear a challenge from the Quebec government to a lower court ruling granting asylum seekers access to subsidized daycare spaces.

title: 7 Hezbollah affiliates killed in rare Israeli strike on central Beirut
description: Israel has been pounding areas of Lebanon where the militant group Hezbollah has a strong presence since late September, but has rarely struck in the heart of the capital.

title: Trudeau to attend Francophonie summit in France. What’s on the agenda?
description: The shadow of a wider conflict in the Middle East will likely loom large over the meeting of French-speaking countries in France.

title: Harris floods the zone with Howard Stern, Stephen Colbert, podcast interviews in final election sprint
description: Vice President Kamala Harris and former President Donald Trump are battling for the airwaves in the final sprint to the Nov. 5 election.

title: China-linked security breach targeted U.S. wiretap systems, WSJ reports
description: U.S. broadband providers had networks breached in a cyberattack tied to the Chinese government that targeted wiretap requests, The Wall Street Journal reports.

title: Nasrallah's possible successor out of contact since Friday, Lebanese source says
description: The loss of Nasrallah's rumored successor would be yet another blow to Hezbollah and its patron Iran.

title: Trump holds Pennsylvania rally at same venue of first assassination attempt, joined by Musk, Vance
description: Elon Musk spoke at Donald Trump's second Butler rally, marking the latest sign of support in their growing alliance.

title: Buttigieg claps back at Elon Musk for false claims about Helene federal response
description: Buttigieg replied to a post from Musk that falsely claimed the FAA was closing airspace in the Hurricane Helene disaster zone.

title: Jamie Dimon denies Trump's claim that JPMorgan CEO has endorsed him
description: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon previously urged corporate leaders to back Nikki Haley over Donald Trump. Trump faces Vice President Kamala Harris in November.

title: 'Business Leaders for Harris' campaign launches a podcast and website featuring Cuban, Hastings, Hoffman and more
description: Vice President Kamala Harris allies in the business community are trying to give her a boost over Donald Trump.

title: Harris campaigns with Liz Cheney in a bid to win over Republicans skeptical of Trump
description: Cheney and Harris took the stage in Ripon, Wisconsin, a city known as "the birthplace of the Republican Party."

title: Missouri judge blocks Biden student loan forgiveness that was cleared to proceed
description: The Biden administration's new sweeping student loan forgiveness plan is temporarily blocked again, a federal judge ruled.

title: Helene recovery could cost $34 billion. Here's who might pay for it.
description: President Joe Biden said Monday that he may have to call on Congress to end its recess early to pass more disaster relief.

title: Trump Media COO quits; DJT turns over more shares to SPAC investor in court fight
description: Andrew Northwall was COO of Trump Media, the Truth Social operator majority owned by Donald Trump that trades as DJT on the Nasdaq.

title: How a tiny town hit by Helene could upend the global semiconductor chip industry
description: Nearly all the world's supply of high-purity quartz, which is required to produce semiconductors, comes from a town that was devastated by Hurricane Helene.

title: Trump election conspiracist Tina Peters sentenced to 9 years in prison by Colorado judge
description: Tina Peters, the former Mesa County, Colorado, clerk, falsely claimed Donald Trump lost the 2020 election to President Joe Biden due to ballot fraud.

title: Biden administration can move forward with student loan forgiveness, federal judge rules
description: A federal judge will let expire a temporary restraining order against the Biden administration's sweeping new student loan forgiveness plan.

title: Melania Trump backs abortion rights: 'No room for compromise' on women's freedom
description: Former first lady Melania Trump, wife of Donald Trump, shared her views on abortion and women's rights in a forthcoming memoir and a promo video for that book.

title: 'Make them riot' — Trump election case judge unseals special counsel motion on immunity
description: Special counsel Jack Smith is continuing efforts to prosecute Donald Trump, as the Republican faces Vice President Kamala Harris in the presidential election.

title: Kalshi resumes taking bets on U.S. election after appeals court lifts freeze
description: KalshiEx offered customers contracts that bet on congressional election outcomes. The Commodity Futures Trading Commission objected.

title: Harris campaign launches small business battleground tour in a play for Latino, Black voters
description: The Harris campaign will announce the new campaign tour hours before her VP pick, Gov. Tim Walz, debates Trump's running mate, Sen. JD Vance.

title: Israeli forces launch ground offensive in Lebanon as markets fear escalation
description: Israel has launched a ground incursion into Lebanese territory, with markets on edge over the escalation in the conflict.

title: Iran launches missile attack on Israel for killing of Hezbollah leader, general
description: Israel launched a ground incursion into Lebanon as part of an attack on Hezbollah, the militant group backed by Iran.

title: VP debate recap: Vance, Walz clash over abortion and immigration, but find common ground on housing
description: Sen. JD Vance, the Republican vice presidential nominee, and Democratic pick Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota debated Tuesday night in New York City.

title: The future of Obamacare hangs on a few seats in Congress. Here's what could happen next
description: Even as Republicans largely accept that the Affordable Care Act is here to stay, they still have very different visions for the program than Democrats do.

title: Israel begins ground offensive against Hezbollah in southern Lebanon
description: The Israeli military says it has begun a "limited, localized" operation against Hezbollah targets in southern Lebanon.

title: Biden administration doubles down on tough asylum restrictions at border
description: The new rules bar migrants from being granted asylum when U.S. officials deem that the southern border is overwhelmed.

title: Hurricane Helene: Trump speaks in Georgia, bashes Harris for not traveling there
description: Donald Trump bashed Vice President Kamala Harris and President Joe Biden in politically charged terms over their response to the deadly Hurricane Helene.

title: Education Dept. extends deadline for defaulted student loan borrowers to get current
description: The Education Department has extended the deadline for its Fresh Start program for defaulted student loan borrowers until early Wednesday morning.

title: Iran's response to Israel will be a choice between revenge and survival. Markets say it's choosing survival
description: Iran's leadership has vowed revenge, but its actions and language suggest — at least so far — a more measured response.

title: U.S. East Coast port strike looms Tuesday with no talks scheduled
description: U.S. East and Gulf Coast port workers are set to go on strike at midnight on Monday with no talks currently scheduled to head off a stoppage.

title: Biden says he won't intervene if port workers go on strike
description: President Joe Biden said on Sunday he did not intend to intervene to prevent a port strike on the East Coast and Gulf of Mexico if dock workers fail to secure a new contract by an Oct. 1 deadline.

title: Mark Cuban warns Elon Musk: Trump’s ‘loyalty is only to himself'
description: Mark Cuban is supporting Vice President Kamala Harris, while Elon Musk has endorsed ex-President Donald Trump in the 2024 election.

title: Sue Gray quits as Sir Keir Starmer's chief of staff
description: She is leaving after rows over pay and donations and will take up a new role as the PM's regional envoy.

title: Starmer 'pleased' assisted dying vote will take place
description: The PM says his views are "well known" but he will look at the details of the bill.

title: Nearly £22bn pledged for carbon capture projects
description: Sir Keir Starmer says carbon capture clusters on Merseyside and Teesside will "kickstart growth".

title: Ex-Labour official offered to help secure minister visits for fee
description: Liam Didsbury told businesses he knew how to arrange visits in a way that "appeals" to ministers.

title: Work-to-rule punishes patients, Streeting tells GPs
description: The health secretary outlined measures on cutting "red tape" and alleviating paperwork for GPs in a speech.

title: Could 'Midlands man' Jenrick become Tory leader?
description: The Wolverhampton-born Newark MP hopes to cement his place in the final run-off in the coming days.

title: Starmer repays more than £6,000 in gifts after donations row
description: The PM is covering the cost of Taylor Swift tickets and other gifts, after criticism over donations.

title: UK will give sovereignty of Chagos Islands to Mauritius
description: In a historic move, the UK gives up sovereignty of a strategic group of islands in the Indian Ocean.

title: Conservative leadership hopefuls vow change to win again
description: Tom Tugendhat, James Cleverly, Robert Jenrick and Kemi Badenoch try to woo members in conference speeches.

title: PM goes to Brussels as he eyes closer UK-EU co-operation
description: Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer visits Brussels, pledging a relationship re-set after Brexit wrangling.

title: Donations row Labour peer Lord Alli investigated by watchdog
description: The investigation follows a complaint made about the Labour donor during the last week.

title: Kuenssberg 'embarrassed' by Johnson message error
description: The presenter's scheduled interview with Johnson was pulled after she accidentally sent him her notes.

title: Chris Mason: Cleverly makes his mark - but will it be enough?
description: The ex-home secretary is looking to close the gap with frontrunners Robert Jenrick and Kemi Badenoch.

title: How Tory leadership talent contest went down in the hall
description: Tom Tugendhat, James Cleverly, Robert Jenrick and Kemi Badenoch take to the stage to make their case to Tory members.

title: Tories search for answers after election drubbing
description: How to recover from its historic defeat in July dominated the party's annual gathering in Birmingham.

title: UK forces involved in response to Iran attacks on Israel
description: British forces "played their part" in attempts to prevent further escalation, the defence secretary says.

Jakhar has stopped attending party meetings and has been in Delhi for more than a week now, they said, adding that he has differences with the party's state general secretary (organisation) Manthri Srinivasulu and has not been able to adopt the party culture.

description: Omar Abdullah wins election, but can he fix jobs and inflation with less power?

title: Kashmir’s first vote in a decade: Silent voices speak up
description: Long-time non-voters turned up at polls, changing the region’s power balance and surprising the old guard.

title: Can you have peace minus the people?: Mohammed Yousuf Tarigami
description: People’s Alliance for Gupkar Declaration spokesperson and MLA from Kulgam says the Centre has done everything to devalue the democratic process.

title: Doctors intensify agitation with indefinite hunger strike to demand justice for R.G. Kar victim
description: Mass resignations of senior doctors follow as the government stalls on reforms, while Puja celebrations take on sombre tone amid the ongoing crisis.

title: Haryana’s surprise election result: A sign of things to come in Maharashtra?
description: While some draw parallels between the two States, a closer look reveals their political realities and electoral challenges are fundamentally distinct.

title: How did the BJP pull off an unexpected win in Haryana?
description: Despite perceived anti-incumbency, the BJP was able to retain support through strategic social engineering and exploit the Congress’ infighting.

title: BJP scores hat-trick in Haryana, NC-Congress combine sweeps Jammu and Kashmir
description: Mixed fortunes for the national parties as regional factors influence outcomes.

title: Former Delhi minister Kailash Gahlot joins BJP, a day after quitting Aam Aadmi Party
description: Kailash Gahlot left AAP for BJP, marking a significant shift ahead of the 2025 Delhi elections. His resignation highlights internal conflicts within the AAP, with allegations of BJP's manipulative politics. Gahlot is the second minister to resign this year, following Raaj Kumar Anand.

title: Jharkhand Assembly Election: As campaign ends today, INDIA bloc allies worry about Congress' lacklustre effort
description: As the Jharkhand Assembly Elections approach, allies within the INDIA bloc express worries over Congress's lacklustre campaign efforts. With key leaders focusing on their seats, the coalition's unity is tested, raising questions about the party's commitment and strategy in the crucial election.

title: Arvind Kejriwal says Delhi Assembly election is a ‘dharamyudh’ for AAP
description: AAP national convener Arvind Kejriwal urges the party’s booth and district-level workers to take on the challenge of reaching every voter

title: Nitin Raut's ‘dropped from Congress for saying Jai Bheem’ claim triggers BJP's ‘Anti Dalit’ remark | Watch Viral video
description: Maharashtra Assembly Polls 2024: In a viral video, Congress leader Nitin Raut alleged he was dismissed from the Vilas Rao Deshmukh cabinet for greeting with 'Jai Bheem.' This prompted ‘Anti Dalit’ remarks from the BJP.

title: Maharashtra Assembly Elections 2024: Will banks remain open or closed on voting day, November 20? Know here
description: Maharashtra Assembly Elections 2024: Maharashtra's Assembly elections are set for November 20, with two coalitions vying for power. The state has approximately 9.63 crore eligible voters.

title: Mallikarjun Kharge says Jharkhand Election Phase 1 voting indicates...
description: Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge said on Saturday that it is clear that the INDIA alliance will form the government again in Jharkhand.

title: EC seeks responses from BJP's JP Nadda, Congress' Mallikarjun Kharge on complaints against each other
description: The Election Commission wrote to BJP president JP Nadda and asked him to comment on the complaint filed by the Congress against the BJP. The poll body send a similar letter to Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge, seeking response on complaints filed against his party by the BJP.

title: ‘Sharam aani chahiye’: Devendra Fadnavis slams Kanhaiya Kumar for ‘Instagram reel’ remark on wife Amruta
description: Maharashtra Election: Devendra Fadnavis said in an interview, “Their [Congress] troll army makes allegations against my wife but I told my wife that we are in politics and we have to keep patience...”

title: Devendra Fadnavis vs Ajit Pawar over ‘batenge toh katenge’: ‘Who stayed with anti-Hindu ideology will take time to…’
description: Maharashtra Election: NCP leader and Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar earlier opposed the ‘batenge to katenge’ raised by Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath during a poll rally.

title: Raj Thackeray's MNS cancels Shivaji Park rally amid Maharashtra elections. Here's why
description: In a surprising turn of events, Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) has cancelled its rally at the historic Shivaji Park due to pending permissions from the Election Commission. Raj Thackeray would now visit assembly segments in Mumbai and Thane to canvass for MNS candidates.

title: Jharkhand Elections: Rahul Gandhi's chopper delay sparks political sabotage allegations. Congress approaches EC
description: As Rahul Gandhi's helicopter faced a 45-minute delay in Jharkhand, Congress leaders accused the government of foul play, suggesting the Air Traffic Control prioritised Prime Minister Modi's rally over Gandhi's campaign.&nbsp;

title: ‘BJP believes in fair election’: Amit Shah shares video of EC officials checking helicopter amid Uddhav bag-checking row
description: Maharashtra Elections: Union Home Minister Amit Shah's helicopter was checked by the Election Commission official in Maharashtra's Hingoli.

title: Jharkhand Assembly Election 2024: Who is Tiger Jairam Mahto? The new face creating waves amid INDIA vs NDA clash
description: Jharkhand Election: Tiger Jairam Mahto is capturing attention with his focus on local pride and the Kudmi community. His new party, the JLKM, aims to shake up the traditional political landscape dominated by national parties. Will he change the game in Jharkhand?

title: Devendra Fadnavis reveals reason for BJP's poor Maharashtra performance in Lok Sabha polls – ‘failed to counter…’
description: Maharashtra's Deputy Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis acknowledges the BJP's poor performance in the Lok Sabha Elections 2024 in the state, attributing it to the party's inability to counter the impactful Bharat Jodo Yatra led by Rahul Gandhi.&nbsp;

title: Who will win Maharashtra Assembly Elections 2024 –  Mahayuti or MVA? Know what THIS pre-poll survey reveals
description: As Maharashtra gears up for the 2024 Assembly Elections, a pre-poll survey reveals predictions on seat distribution between ruling Mahayuti and opposition MVA. With a history of inaccuracies, can these forecasts be trusted? Dive into the data and implications of this political showdown.

title: Who is Maharashtra’s wealthiest candidate with net worth of  ₹3,382 crore: gold, diamonds, mutual funds...
description: In the upcoming Maharashtra elections, BJP's Parag Shah stands out with a staggering net worth of  ₹3,382 crore. Discover how this real estate mogul transformed his fortunes from  ₹500 crore in 2019 to the wealthiest candidate in the race and what his assets reveal about his financial empire.

title: Maharashtra Election: At Mumbai rally, PM Modi's ‘remote control’ jibe at Uddhav, likens Congress to ‘fish out of water’
description: Maharashtra Election In a fiery rally in Mumbai, PM Modi criticised Uddhav Thackeray's leadership, claiming the Shiv Sena has lost its identity by aligning with Congress.

title: Jharkhand Assembly Election: Richest candidate has  ₹400 crore net worth. Who is he?
description: In the Jharkhand Assembly elections, the richest candidate, Aquil Akhtar, boasts a staggering  ₹400 crore in assets, while others declare as little as  ₹100. This stark contrast highlights the wealth disparity among candidates as the state is in the middle of a high-stakes electoral battle.

title: Maharashtra Election: PM Modi receives special welcome by ISKCON monks in Panvel | Video
description: Maharashtra Election: A video showed the ISKCON volunteers singing “Hare Rama, Hare Krishna” as Prime Minister Narendra Modi played the cymbals.

title: ‘Fulfilled Balasaheb Thackeray’s wish’: What PM Modi said at Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar rally in Maharashtra
description: Maharashtra elections: Prime Minister Narendra Modi hit out at Maha Vikas Aghadi, saying that despite being in power for two and a half years, the alliance did not have the courage to rename Aurangabad as Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar due to pressure from the Congress.

title: Maharashtra Assembly Election: Now, BJP MLC Pankaja Munde opposes Yogi's ‘batenge to katenge’ slogan – ‘my belief…’
description: Maharashtra: Opposition to the BJP's 'batenge to katenge' slogan grows among Mahayuti leaders Ajit Pawar and Pankaja Munde, who argue it does not suit Maharashtra's political climate. They call for a focus on development ahead of the upcoming assembly polls on November 20.

title: Sri Lanka votes today: President Dissanayake faces litmus test as NPP aims for majority control | All you need to know
description: As Sri Lanka heads to the polls today, President Dissanayake faces a critical test for his National People’s Power party amid a backdrop of economic crisis and political upheaval. With the nation seeking accountability and reform, the election results could reshape the country's future.

title: Lok Sabha Bypoll: Wayanad records lowest-ever turnout. ‘A big thank you…,’ says Priyanka Gandhi Vadra
description: Wayanad's bypoll on Wednesday saw the lowest voter turnout since 2009 at 64.24% following a devastating landslide. Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, making her electoral debut, thanks voters for their participation and vows to uphold democratic ideals amidst challenges.

title: PM Modi to address rally at Mumbai's Shivaji Park ahead of Maharashtra Assembly Elections
description: Ahead of the November 20 Assembly polls in Maharashtra, PM Modi will address a rally in Shivaji Park, Mumbai. Maharashtra Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis, and top BJP leaders from the state will address the rally. &nbsp;

title: ‘Even if Indiraji comes from heaven…’: Amit Shah attacks Rahul Gandhi, next 'four generations' over Article 370
description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said Indira Gandhi may come down from heaven but Article 370 won't be restored.

title: Jharkhand Assembly Election: Phase 1 records 66% voter turnout, slightly better than 2019
description: Jharkhand Assembly Election: In the first phase of the Jharkhand Assembly elections, voter turnout hit 66.48%, slightly above the 63.9% recorded in 2019. With the ruling JMM-led INDIA alliance and BJP-led NDA vying for power, this election could significantly reshape the state's political landscape.

title: 'Sonia ji, your Rahul aircraft will crash again in Maharashtra elections': Amit Shah
description: Maharashtra Elections: Union Home Minister and BJP leader Amit Shah said that ‘Rahul aircraft’ will crash again and exuded confidence that Bharatiya Janata Party-led Mahayuti will again form the government in the state.

title: Maharashtra polls: Those claiming Hindus in danger denying reservation to Marathas, says Manoj Jarange Patil
description: In his most explicit attack on the 'Mahayuti' govt, Manoj Jarange Patil said interest of every section of society has suffered on its watch, asserting that Marathas will show their might in the polls

title: Eknath Shinde, Ramdas Athawale's bags searched amid Uddhav Thackeray bag-checking controversy: Video
description: Amid ongoing controversy over checking the bag of Shiv Sena UBT chief Uddhav Thackeray, the election officials on Wednesday checked the bags of Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde and Union Minister Ramdas Athawale.

title: Rajasthan bypolls: Independent candidate from Deoli-Uniara seat slaps official | Watch video
description: The incident that took place at the Samravata polling station was caught on camera.

title: ‘Stand up on your own legs’: Supreme Court schools Ajit Pawar's NCP for using Sharad Pawar's photos, videos
description: The Supreme Court has ordered Ajit Pawar's faction of the NCP to stop using images of Sharad Pawar in the Maharashtra elections, emphasizing the need for separate identities amid ongoing disputes between the factions.

title: Maharashtra Election: SOP, says EC on Uddhav Thackeray's bag checking, cites instances involving Nadda, Shah
description: During a public meeting, Uddhav Thackeray expressed concern over his bag being checked. Election Commission sources have confirmed in a report that all checks adhere to Standard Operating Procedures, ensuring fairness in the electoral process.

title: Wayanad bypolls: Rahul Gandhi urges votes for sister Priyanka, ‘is ready to be your voice…’
description: Wayanad bypolls: Rahul Gandhi has urged voters in Wayanad to support his sister Priyanka's bid for the Lok Sabha seat. He assured them that she would be their “voice” in Parliament.

title: Jharkhand Assembly Election: In 2019, JMM won 17 of 43 seats voting in phase 1 today, BJP bagged 13
description: Jharkhand Assembly elections commence with voting for 43 seats. Key candidates include Champai Soren (BJP) and Purnima Das Sahu. The ruling JMM-led INDIA bloc takes on the BJP-led NDA, with results set for November 23. In 2019, JMM had won 17 of the seats where voting is being held today.

title: Jharkhand assembly elections: PM Modi urges voters to show ‘full enthusiasm in this festival of democracy’
description: Jharkhand assembly elections: PM Modi urged Jharkhand voters to participate enthusiastically in the assembly elections today. Voting for 43 seats began at 7 am, with 683 candidates, including former leaders. The second phase will occur on November 20, and vote counting is scheduled for November 23.

title: Kailash Gahlot joins BJP, a day after quitting Arvind Kejriwal's AAP
description: Former Delhi Transport Minister and prominent AAP figure, Kailash Gahlot, resigned from the party and joined the BJP. Gahlot cited recent controversies, including the "Sheshmahal" controversy, and unfulfilled promises as reasons for his departure. He accused the AAP of prioritizing its own agenda over the needs of the people.

title: North India facing medical emergency due to stubble burning: Atishi
description: Delhi Chief Minister Atishi attributed the hazardous air quality in north India to stubble burning in BJP-ruled states. She commended Punjab, governed by AAP, for reducing stubble burning incidents, while criticizing the BJP for inaction. Delhi's air quality reached 'severe plus' levels, prompting stricter pollution control measures.

title: We are planning to file suit against this: Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah on PM Modi's 'looting' remarks against state
description: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah is considering legal action against Prime Minister Narendra Modi for accusing the Congress party of "looting" the state. Siddaramaiah called Modi's claims, made during a Maharashtra rally, lies intended to sway voters. The Chief Minister also criticized Union Minister HD Kumaraswamy for not advocating for Karnataka's fair share of tax revenue from the central government.

title: Rahul Gandhi explains BJP's 'ek hai to safe hai' slogan, targets PM Modi, Gautam Adani
description: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi addressed the media in Mumbai. He criticized the BJP's slogan and linked it to Gautam Adani's influence. Gandhi highlighted the shift of major projects from Maharashtra to Gujarat. He promised to remove the 50% reservation cap and conduct a caste census if Congress comes to power.

title: Amit Shah to hold key meeting on Manipur
description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will hold a meeting today to address the security situation in Manipur. The meeting will focus on developing a strategy to manage the volatile situation in the state. National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and other top officials will attend. This follows protests and violence in Manipur after the discovery of bodies, including women and children.

title: Inciteful, ECI should take action against this: BJP's Pradeep Bhandari on Kharge's remarks on BJP-RSS
description: BJP leader Pradeep Bhandari has criticized Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge's recent statements about the BJP and RSS, deeming them as potentially inflammatory and urging the Election Commission of India to intervene. Kharge, during a rally in Maharashtra, had compared the BJP-RSS to "poison" and labeled them as a political threat.

title: 'I know brother Thirumavalavan's heart,' says CM Stalin
description: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin acknowledged VCK chief Thol Thirumavalavan's gratitude for establishing an industrial park in Ariyalur. While Thirumavalavan reiterated VCK's stance on power-sharing, he clarified that the 2026 election isn't the right time for the demand and affirmed VCK's continued alliance with DMK.

title: Achievement proof of PM's popularity, strong leadership: CM Dhami on PM Modi conferred with Nigeria's national award
description: Prime Minister of India Narendra Modi received Nigeria's highest national honor, the Grand Commander of the Order of the Niger (GCON). Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami praised PM Modi's leadership. PM Modi was also presented with the 'Key to the City' of Abuja. This was the first visit by an Indian Prime Minister to Nigeria in 17 years.

title: J&K LG chairs review meeting, Congress says two power centres in J&K not in national interest
description: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha chaired a high-level security meeting in Jammu, emphasizing the need to combat terrorism and accelerate infrastructure development.  Congress leader Tariq Hameed Karra raised concerns about potential conflicts arising from separate security reviews by the LG and the Chief Minister.

title: Maharashtra polls: As Maratha, OBCs face off, Pankaja Munde speaks of unity
description: Pankaja, who has addressed around 40 rallies, tries to connect with voters, and says, "don't be disheartened if I am not contesting. I will take care of your all issues". On attempts being made to polarise voters on caste and religious lines, Pankaja told ET that she looks at all voters as her own. "That's what my father has taught me and people from all faith have voted for me."

title: Third eye: J&K's new buzzword, goodbye my captain & thinking on her feet
description: Jammu and Kashmir's government offices are grappling with confusion surrounding the 'Transaction of Business Rules', leading to bureaucratic delays. Meanwhile, the Supreme Court Registry paid tribute to former Chief Justice DY Chandrachud with a special booklet commemorating his legacy. In Maharashtra, politician Supriya Sule demonstrated quick thinking by avoiding a potentially controversial photo opportunity at a rally.

title: Maharashtra polls: Three leading candidates have Congress roots in Savner Assembly constituency
description: Entrenched former Congress minister and four-term MLA Sunil Kedar this time is in the role of being the prime mover of the campaign of Congress candidate Anuja Kedar, his wife. His was not a voluntary retirement but a forced exit after his conviction and jailing in a cooperative bank scam case.

title: Modi building wall between Gujarati and others: Uddhav
description: Uddhav Thackeray, speaking at a rally in Mumbai, accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah of prioritizing Gujarat over other states. He alleged that they are creating a divide between Gujaratis and the rest of the country, likening it to building a wall that will be difficult to dismantle.

title: Maharashtra polls: It's tight, but there's no rebel and I will win, says Prithviraj Chavan on Karad South seat
description: The constituency has been known as a Congress bastion for several decades which the BJP hopes to change this time. BJP's candidate is Atul Bhosle, who is not a novice in the constituency. Bhosle, whose family runs a sugar factory as a medical college, has contested twice against Chavan since 2014. While Bhosle lost both times, the BJP and Bhosle have been taking confidence from Chavan's declining winning margins and Bhosle's improved performance.

title: No end, houses of 5 more MLAs set afire
description: Following the discovery of six bodies in Manipur, violence erupted as mobs targeted the homes of government officials, including the chief minister.  Security forces responded to protesters with tear gas and rubber bullets, leading to injuries.  A curfew is in place, and internet access has been restricted in several districts.

title: Maharashtra Assembly Elections: Priyanka Gandhi accuses the BJP of toppling MVA govt. to favour Adani
Amid protests, Punjab Governor says no land allotted for Haryana Assembly in Chandigarh yet
description: Punjab Governor Gulab Chand Kataria clarified that no land in Chandigarh has been allotted to Haryana for a new Assembly building yet. This statement comes amidst protests by political parties against the Centre's reported move to grant 10 acres of land to Haryana in exchange for land in Panchkula.

title: Amit Shah reviews security situation in Manipur
description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah reviewed the security situation in Manipur following a series of violent protests and directed officials to take all necessary steps to restore peace. The unrest erupted after the discovery of bodies, prompting mob violence and arson attacks on the residences of elected officials.  The situation remains volatile despite a curfew and increased security measures.

title: 'Batenge to Katenge' an idea, not just catchphrase: Minister Gajendra Shekhawat
description: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat stated that 'Batenge to Katenge' is not just a slogan but an idea, criticizing Congress for viewing it religiously. He argued that Congress's history of divisive politics based on religion, socioeconomic status, and caste led to the partition of India.

title: 'Anti-Telugu’ remarks: Actor Kasthuri remanded to judicial custody till November 29
Pressure from ED, CBI forced Kailash Gahlot to quit: AAP
description: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has accused the BJP of using central agencies to pressure former Delhi minister Kailash Gahlot into resigning. Gahlot, who quit AAP on Sunday, cited controversies and unfulfilled promises as reasons for his departure.

title: Manipur: National People's Party to withdraw support from Biren Singh govt with immediate effect
description: The National People's Party (NPP) has withdrawn its support from the BJP-led government in Manipur, citing the government's failure to control the deteriorating law and order situation and restore normalcy.  Ethnic violence between the Meitei and Kuki-Zo communities has resulted in over 230 deaths and widespread displacement since May of last year.

title: Karnataka BJP says it’s got clean-chit from Lokayukta in 40% Commission case, demands CM Siddaramaiah’s apology
description: The Karnataka Lokayukta found no evidence to support the "40% commission" allegations leveled against the previous BJP government by the Congress during the 2022 assembly elections. The BJP is demanding an apology from Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar for their alleged smear campaign, while the Congress remains silent on the Lokayukta's findings.

title: PM Modi and Nigerian President Bola Ahmed Tinubu hold delegation-level talks in Abuja
Shashi Tharoor flags stagnant follower count on X for 4 years
description: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has publicly questioned X about his stagnant follower count despite raising the issue with the platform multiple times, including with Elon Musk directly. Tharoor's attempts to address the issue were met with denial from X, further fueling his suspicion of potential manipulation.

title: J&K: In its 1st month, Omar Abdullah govt focuses on public welfare, pressing issues
description: Omar Abdullah's government in Jammu and Kashmir marked its first month with initiatives aimed at improving quality of life and tackling unemployment. Key actions included securing additional power supply, advocating for the restoration of statehood, and transforming the CM's residence into a public redressal office.

title: Truth coming out: PM Modi on movie on Godhra train burning
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, referencing a film about the 2002 Godhra train burning, stated that the truth will always surface. He was responding to praise for the movie "Sabarmati Report," which highlights the incident where over 50 passengers died. While some claimed it was an accident, courts ultimately convicted individuals for setting the train ablaze.

title: Manipur violence: Curfew imposed, internet suspended in 7 districts amid raging protests
Delhi Minister Kailash Gahlot resigns from AAP; party claims ED, CBI pressure
Baba Siddique murder: Gujarat man held from Akola, 25th arrest in case
description: Police in Mumbai have arrested a 25th suspect in connection with the murder of Nationalist Congress Party leader Baba Siddique. Salmanbhai Iqbalbhai Vohra, 66, was apprehended in Akola, Maharashtra. Authorities allege that Vohra provided financial assistance to individuals linked to the crime, including the brother of one of the accused. Siddique was fatally shot near his son's office in October.

title: Meritocracy being murdered in J&K by National Conference: PDP leader Iltija Mufti
description: Iltija Mufti criticized the National Conference for its reservation policy in Jammu and Kashmir. Mufti stated that the party's promises on reservation were not true. She pointed to an advertisement for paramedical courses at Anantnag's Government Medical College as evidence. The advertisement showed a limited number of seats available for open merit candidates.

title: BJP deliberately wants Manipur to burn: Kharge
description: Violence flared in Manipur. Congress leaders blamed the BJP for the unrest. Protesters targeted homes of government officials. Authorities imposed restrictions and cut internet access in some areas. The violence follows the discovery of bodies, escalating tensions in the state.

title: Aaditya Thackeray, Uddhav Thackeray pay tribute to Shiv Sena founder Balasaheb on his death anniversary
Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot quits Aam Aadmi Party
description: Kailash Gahlot Resignation: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot resigned from the primary membership of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Sunday, citing concerns over the party's direction. In a letter to AAP convener Arvind Kejriwal, Gahlot expressed that political ambitions had overshadowed the party's commitment to its core values and promises, such as cleaning the Yamuna River, which remains highly polluted.

title: Houses of 4 more MLAs torched in Manipur, agitators attempt to storm CM's ancestral residence
description: Angry mobs in Manipur targeted the homes of multiple BJP and Congress legislators, setting fire to several residences. This wave of violence, sparked by the alleged killing of six people by militants, prompted authorities to impose a curfew and suspend internet services in several districts.

title: "I'll retire from politics if PM proves his allegations against Congress in Karnataka": CM Siddaramaiah
description: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah challenged Prime Minister Narendra Modi's allegations of fund misuse for Maharashtra elections. Siddaramaiah denied claims of looting and dared PM Modi to prove the allegations, vowing to quit politics if found true. He highlighted his government's welfare schemes and urged Maharashtra to vote for development and progress.

title: Third eye: In 2024, 1993 batch calls the shots, not okay with everything said, and conflicting stands on bag searching
description: The 1993 batch of the Indian Administrative Service is taking on key roles in Delhi, with members heading important ministries. Meanwhile, in Maharashtra's political scene, Ajit Pawar responded to Sharad Pawar's campaign for Yugendra Pawar, stating he wasn't pleased with the endorsement.  In contrast to Uddhav Thackeray's previous anger, Eknath Shinde calmly allowed election officials to search his bags.

title: My sister tells me PM repeating things, maybe he has memory loss, Rahul Gandhi says
description: During a campaign rally in Amravati, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi drew a comparison between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US President Joe Biden, suggesting that both leaders experience memory lapses. Gandhi recounted an instance where his sister, Priyanka Gandhi, observed similarities between their party's stance and statements made by the Prime Minister.

title: Gujarat BJP chief unlikely before national head is elected
description: Gujarat BJP will get a new state president after the national president is elected. Current president Chandrakant Patil's term ended in July. He was appointed as a Union Minister. Patil led BJP to a landslide victory in the 2022 assembly polls. The party will appoint a new state president before the upcoming local body elections.

title: EC notices to BJP, Cong chiefs regarding Shah, RG
description: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has issued notices to BJP president J P Nadda and Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge seeking responses to alleged violations of the model code of conduct by their respective party leaders during election campaigns.

title: SAD convenes Working Committee meeting on Nov 18 to discuss Badal's resignation
description: Shiromani Akali Dal will hold a meeting on November 18. The meeting will discuss Sukhbir Singh Badal's resignation from the party's President post. The party will also discuss the next course of action. The election for the new President will be discussed. Shiromani Akali Dal dissolved its core committee in July. Some leaders demanded a change in leadership.

title: Manipur women in anguish after horrific killings in Imphal spark unrest ‘Tell us name of culprit…’
'Temporary' Cong govt in Himachal can fall anytime, claims BJP's Harsh Mahajan
description: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Harsh Mahajan claimed that several Congress MLAs in Himachal Pradesh are in contact with the BJP and predicted the collapse of the Congress government. Mahajan cited dissatisfaction with CM Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu's leadership and the recent High Court ruling against the appointment of chief parliamentary secretaries as factors contributing to the instability.

title: SAD Chief Sukhbir Badal bows to party pressure, quits post
description: Sukhbir Singh Badal resigned as the leader of the Shiromani Akali Dal following the party's poor showing in recent elections. Badal's resignation, which came after calls from within the party for a change in leadership, sets the stage for a new party president to be chosen at a meeting on Monday.

title: Any party joining hands with Congress is doomed: Rajnath Singh
description: Rajnath Singh, Union Minister, stated that the Congress is in decline and its allies in Maharashtra will face consequences. He expressed confidence in the victory of the BJP and Mahayuti coalition in the Maharashtra assembly elections. Singh highlighted the BJP's success in Haryana and the positive impact of Prime Minister Modi's leadership.

title: BJP-ruled states sending diesel buses to Delhi to aggravate pollution problem: Rai
description: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai accused BJP-ruled neighboring states of worsening the capital's pollution by sending BS IV diesel buses despite a ban.  Rai stated that these states are deliberately violating GRAP III guidelines by sending prohibited vehicles. He highlighted that 70% of Delhi's pollution originates from outside sources.  Enforcement teams are actively issuing challans to violators.

title: 'Batenge toh katenge' negative slogan: Akhilesh Yadav
description: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticized the BJP's "batenge toh katenge" slogan, calling it divisive and similar to British rule. He accused the BJP government in Uttar Pradesh of neglecting infrastructure, healthcare, and unemployment, leading to anger among youth. Yadav expressed confidence in the opposition's victory in the upcoming Maharashtra Assembly polls.

title: Congress government ordering probe into Covid-19 handling during BJP regime has malafide intent: Yediyurappa
description: B S Yediyurappa stated the Congress government's probe into Covid-19 management during the BJP's tenure was driven by ulterior motives. He defended the BJP government's handling of the pandemic, claiming they worked sincerely to save lives. Yediyurappa believes this investigation is an attempt to distract from the MUDA case, which implicates Chief Minister Siddaramaiah in alleged irregularities.

title: MP CM Mohan Yadav's visit to UK, Germany: Congress calls it 'open drama for investment'
description: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister's upcoming visit to the UK and Germany for investment opportunities has sparked criticism from the Congress, calling it a publicity stunt and comparing it to Prime Minister Modi's international trips. The BJP defended the visit, stating it was crucial for attracting investments and improving the state's development.

title: Manipur: Fresh violence rocks Imphal over recent killings, MLAs’ houses set ablaze by protesters
After Flurry of Cabinet Picks, Trump Rethinks Candidates for Treasury Secretary
description: President-elect Donald J. Trump is expected to invite the contenders for the role, including Kevin Warsh and Marc Rowan, to Mar-a-Lago this week.

title: Biden’s Policies Offer a Starting Point for Trump’s Border Crackdown
description: Mr. Trump has criticized the Biden administration for what he calls its lax handling of the border — but it has left him with tools he can use to shut down the border.

title: Gaetz Report Drama Brings a House Republican Feud Full Circle
description: A vendetta over the congressional ethics investigation into Matt Gaetz helped sink the last speaker. The new speaker has moved to quash it.

title: Biden Allows Ukraine to Strike Russia With Long-Range U.S. Missiles
description: With two months left in office, the president for the first time authorized the Ukrainian military to use the system known as ATACMS to help defend its forces in the Kursk region of Russia.

title: Trump Picks Brendan Carr to Lead F.C.C.
description: Mr. Carr, who currently sits on the commission and is a vocal critic of Big Tech, has said the agency should regulate the tech industry.

title: What Are ATACMS, the U.S. Missiles That May Be Used Against Russia?
